result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony J Brayden was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
3 day(s) RCJ for contempt for failure to pay.  $200 DNA surcharge assessed.
Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.

With Huber for employment. DO NOT REPORT LATE OR UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF ALCOHOL OR CONTROLLED SUBSTANCES.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY REQUIRED.
Concurrent with: 15CM667.

INCIDENT REPORT from Zimmerman Consulting Inc. - defendant is in violation of agency requirements.

Defendant Anthony J Brayden in court with attorney Dirk Christian Jensen.  Matthew J. Hastings appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Def is requesting a change of plea date.
BTC: Date set.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Deft needs to test clean at ZCI.

BTC: Matter adjourned. Deft to go to ZCI after court today.  Status conference scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
from Zimmerman Consulting Inc. - defendant is in violation of agency requirements.
Status conference on July 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: No contact with victim store, Pick and Save, except for restitution purposes. No contact with the co-defendants, BH and ER. No contact with the victim SWW (person, property, residence or family).   No violent contact with the victim anyone else named in the complaint (person, property, residence or family).   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 4:00 p.m.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Anthony J Brayden in court with attorney Dirk Christian Jensen.  Thomas Jerome Coaty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley. 
BTC: VACATE WARRANT. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.

  Status conference scheduled for July 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony J Brayden not in court.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  No appearance, Bench/Arrest Warrant requested/ordered, bond forfeited.
